findings.title: Possible Costly lp_token From Improper Staking Initialization
findings.description: The ERC20Staking contract allows users to stake supported target_token tokens and get lp_token tokens in return. However, during initialization, a malicious actor can make the pool token extremely expensive by transferring a huge amount of target_token tokens, leading to precision issues and potential loss for later stakers.

findings.title: Redundant State/Code Removal
findings.description: In the `PLiquidateAgent` contract, there is an unused code or unnecessary redundancy that can be safely removed.

findings.title: Trust Issue Of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Plutos implementation, there is a privileged owner account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol-wide operations.

findings.title: Potential Reentrancy Risk In Plutos Implementation
findings.description: The `Plutos` implementation has potential reentrancy risk due to non-adherence of `checks-effects-interactions` principle in Solidity, which can lead to a malicious contract re-entering a vulnerable contract in a nested manner.
